articles.title: Meet the scientist on a mission to bring diversity to aerospace
articles.description: Cécile Deprez from the German Aerospace Centre discusses satellite navigation systems and positioning research, and how she encourages diversity in STEM.
articles.content:
Cécile Deprez from the German Aerospace Centre discusses the democratisation of space in more ways than one.
For aerospace researcher, Cécile Deprez, part of her mission is to advocate for women and LGBTQIA+ people in STEM fields. Deprez describes ae... [7002 chars]

articles.title: Acinetobacter baumannii can fall into a deep sleep to survive harsh conditions
articles.description: A research team led by Beate Averhoff and Volker Müller of Goethe University Frankfurt has discovered a fundamental mechanism that helps the dreaded hospital pathogen Acinetobacter baumannii to survive.
articles.content: A research team led by Beate Averhoff and Volker Müller of Goethe University Frankfurt has discovered a fundamental mechanism that helps the dreaded hospital pathogen Acinetobacter baumannii to survive. This mechanism explains why the pathogen is dif... [4503 chars]

articles.title: With a growing waiting list, Pune’s transplant body looks at organ donation after cardiac death
articles.description: Symbiosis University Hospital and Research Centre performs first kidney transplant
articles.content: With the waiting list for organs increasing every year, the Zonal Transplant Coordination Centre, Pune region, is seriously exploring the need to retrieve organs from cardiac-dead patients. Presently, organ donation takes place when the donor has die... [3254 chars]

articles.title: Ancient Egypt Was a Hotbed of Venomous Snakes, Evidence Suggests
articles.description: How much can the written records of ancient civilisations tell us about the animals they lived alongside? Our latest research, based on the venomous snakes described in an ancient Egyptian papyrus, suggests more than you might think.
articles.content:
How much can the written records of ancient civilisations tell us about the animals they lived alongside? Our latest research, based on the venomous snakes described in an ancient Egyptian papyrus, suggests more than you might think.

articles.title: Virtual driving assessment can identify at-risk young drivers
articles.description: New research published today by the journal Pediatrics found that driving skills measured at the time of licensure on a virtual driving assessment (VDA), which exposes drivers to common serious crash scenarios, helps predict crash risk in newly licensed young drivers.
articles.content: New research published today by the journal Pediatrics found that driving skills measured at the time of licensure on a virtual driving assessment (VDA), which exposes drivers to common serious crash scenarios, helps predict crash risk in newly licen... [6615 chars]

articles.title: Global Smartphone Market Slumps To Lowest Q3 Level In Decade: Report
articles.description: The global smartphone market contracted by 8% to its lowest thirdquarter level in a decade on subdued demand for major brands including Apple and Samsung in most developed markets, according to data from Counterpoint Research.
articles.content:
The global smartphone market contracted by 8% to its lowest third-quarter level in a decade on subdued demand for major brands including Apple and Samsung in most developed markets, according to data from Counterpoint Research.
The data, shared exclu... [1557 chars]

articles.title: More than half of people do not trust NHS to deliver timely cancer treatment - poll
articles.description: Liberal Democrat leader Sir Ed Davey said the Conservatives have broken people's faith in the NHS - as new research shows people are ignoring potentially cancerous moles or attempting to remove them themselves.
articles.content:
More than half of people have no faith they would receive timely treatment on the NHS if they were diagnosed with cancer, a poll has suggested.
The poll, by Savanta for the Liberal Democrats, also showed people are ignoring moles they think are cance... [2582 chars]

articles.title: University of California and NASA Ames unveil plans for $2 billion Berkeley Space Center
articles.description: The University of California, Berkeley, and the NASA Ames Research Center unveiled plans Oct. 16 for a $2 billion Berkeley Space Center at NASA Research Park.
articles.content:
SAN FRANCISCO – The University of California, Berkeley, and the NASA Ames Research Center unveiled plans Oct. 16 for a $2 billion Berkeley Space Center in Mountain View, California.

articles.description:
Le marché mondial des smartphones a atteint son niveau le plus bas pour un troisième trimestre depuis dix ans, a indiqué lundi le cabinet d'études Counterpoint Research.

articles.content:
San Francisco (awp/afp) - Le marché mondial des smartphones a atteint son niveau le plus bas pour un troisième trimestre depuis dix ans, a indiqué lundi le cabinet d'études Counterpoint Research.

articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried directed political donations despite $13 bln 'hole', ex-colleague testified
articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried directed that money from his Alameda Research hedge fund be used to make political donations after he learned the fund owed $13 billion to customers of his FTX cryptocurrency exchange, a former executive testified on Monday.
articles.content: [1/6] Former FTX Chief Executive Sam Bankman-Fried, who faces fraud charges over the collapse of the bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange, leaves following a hearing at Manhattan federal court in New York City, U.S. January 3, 2023. REUTERS/Andrew Kelly/... [4982 chars]
